Experience ENGINEER.CUSTOMER SUPPORT Cisco Systems December 2012  – Present (2 years 9 months) RTP, NC TAC EAST: SAN 
============ 
Customer support for Cisco SAN technologies, including:  
Cisco MDS9000 
FC/FCoE on N7k, N5k 
FIP Snooping on N4k 
DCNM/FM and Device Manager 
etc... CALO CO-OP - 2nd term TAC rotation Cisco August 2012  –  December 2012  (5 months) RTP, NC Undergraduate Student Worker - TAC rotation on Cisco SAN TAC team.  
 
During this TAC rotation I was introduced to the Fibre Channel Protocol, FCoE, DCNM/FM management applications, etc. Improved soft skills by taking cases and assisting customers/partners with SAN switching technologies, while assisting and learning from senior SAN engineers. Collaborated with engineers from other technologies to help drive Data Center issues to resolution. 
 
Helped organize and update RTP's SAN lab space, using experienced gained from prior CALO rotation. Opened bugs when necessary and contributed to internal knowledgebase with technical articles. CALO CO-OP - Customer Advocacy Lab Operations Cisco Systems January 2012  –  June 2012  (6 months) RTP, NC Undergraduate Student Worker in Cisco AS(Advanced Services) Lab 
Build Enterprise size recreates for Cisco AS engineers 
Install Supervisors and linecards to director class switches... 6500, 4500, 7000, etc... 
Load IOS/NX-OS .bin files to device for installation 
Set boot statements and install IOS/NX-OS firmware 
Verify SFP compatibility and cable recreates with respective use of copper/fiber media 
Utilize cable management for organization and efficiency 
Use Cisco's patch system for distanced connections 
 
Towards the end of my Cisco AS lab rotation, with consent of my present manager(Tim Leese) I built a replica of the CCNP Tshoot lab for intern/co-op studying purposes. The lab consisted of the following devices: 
-3 Cisco 1941 Routers(w/ no ip routing configured to act as hosts/servers) 
-4 Cisco 2911 Routers 
-2 Cisco 3550 Switches 
The intent of this lab was to provide interns/co-ops a central pod for studying layer 2/3 networking technologies. Experience CALO Co-op Technical Services Cisco June 2015  – Present (3 months) Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina Area A CALO Co-op supports the Technical Assistance Center (TAC) and Advanced Services (AS) organizations within Cisco by recreating segments of a customer network in a lab environment. 
 
Job Responsibilities: 
• Monitor the case-tracking tool for recreate requests. Locate and interconnect physical layer components. Establish layer 2 and layer 3 connectivity and load appropriate IOS images when required. Complete cases within specified time frame. 
• Update and maintain the Inventory Tracking Management and System for all equipment within CALO labs. 
• Maintain lab cleanliness. 
• Install and remove equipment within CALO labs. 
• Upgrade memory for routers, switches, and PCs. 
• Provide peer training and mentor newer coops. 
• Provide general lab infrastructure support. 
• Work towards Cisco certifications. Coops are expected to receive their CCNA before completing their first term. 
• Attend weekly team meetings. 4-year degree from an accredited university required Cisco Services Lab Operations (CALO) Co-Op Undergraduate Worker Cisco June 2014  –  May 2015  (1 year) raleigh-durham, north carolina area A CALO Co-op is to support the Technical Assistance Center (TAC) and Advanced Services (AS) organizations by recreating segments of a customer network in a lab environment. Because engineers within these organizations are addressing network issues that directly impact Cisco's customers, timely resolution of recreates is paramount.  
 
Job Responsibilities: 
• Monitor the case-tracking tool for recreate requests. Locate and interconnect physical layer components. Establish layer 2 and layer 3 connectivity and load appropriate IOS images when required. Complete cases within specified time frame. 
• Update and maintain the Inventory Tracking Management and System for all equipment within CALO labs. 
• Maintain lab cleanliness. 
• Install and remove equipment within CALO labs. 
• Enforce lab policies and assist with ISO compliance. 
• Upgrade memory for routers, switches, and PCs. 
• Build and maintain lab computers. 
• Provide peer training and mentor newer coops. 
• Identify equipment shortages and notify permanent CALO personnel. 
• Provide general lab infrastructure support. 
• Work towards Cisco certifications. Coops are expected to receive their CCNA before completing their first term. 
• Attend weekly team meetings. Activities and Societies:  Phi Theta Kappa International Honor Society Honors & Awards Delta Epsilon Iota Academic Honor Society: Iota Omega Chapter East Carolina University Iota Omega Chapter September 2014 What is DEI: 
The Omega Iota Chapter of the Delta Epsilon Iota Academic Honor Society (DEI) works with university career centers to develop a strong relationship between students and their career ideals. Our mission is to promote the ideals of Dedication, Enthusiasm, and Initiative through student leadership, special programs coordinated with the career center, campus, community service projects, and regular networking opportunities for members.The academic requirements for membership include sophomore status (and above), having earned at least 30 semester hours with a minimum GPA of 3.3. 
 
Mission:  
To promote the ideals of Dedication, Enthusiasm, and Initiative at East Carolina University through student leadership, special programs coordinated with the career center, campus and community service projects, and regular networking opportunities for members.

The primary responsibility of a CALO Co-op is to support the Technical Assistance Center (TAC) and Advanced Services (AS) organizations by recreating segments of a customer network in a lab environment. Because engineers within these organizations are addressing network issues that directly impact Cisco's customers, timely resolution of recreates is paramount. 
 
This position generally requires the following skills: 
•Candidate should have demonstrated an expressed interest in the computer networking industry. 
•Successful candidate is required to be enrolled as a full time student at an accredited University in a Computer Science/Electrical Engineering/Computer Engineering program, and must be demonstrate an expressed interest in the computer networking industry. 
•Position requires strong communication skills. Candidate must have a GPA of 3.0 or higher. 
•Previous work experience in the networking industry and completion of Cisco certifications are a plus. 
•Experience with various operating systems such as Windows 2000, Unix, Linux, etc is desired. 
•Candidates must possess excellent interpersonal communication skills. 
•Candidate must be able to convey, receive, process, and retain technical information in a short period of time. 
•Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet established deadlines. 
•Candidates should be able to adapt to various work environments requiring individuals to work effectively as a team member while simultaneously prioritizing and completing individual projects. 
•Candidates should express a desire and capacity to learn complex information.

Evans St. Greenville, NC A Geek Squad Advanced Repair Agent is a brand ambassador for both the Geek Squad and Best Buy brands. They quickly and accurately diagnose technology issues and create robust solutions as needed. They identify and take advantage of opportunities to improve the process of assessing, testing and performing store and customer repairs. They help other employees understand how to successfully use the range of Geek Squad resources in solving customer needs to ensure no customer is ever left unserved or underserved. 
 
While in this role, I am largely responsible for maintaining, repairing and servicing products aligning with the customers "definition of fixed." This includes performing data back-ups and data recovery, hardware repairs and installs to include both laptops, desktops, tablets and cell-phones and software repairs, reloads and virus and spyware removals ranging from Operating Systems to include Windows XP, Vista, 7,8, 8.1, iOS, OSX and Android. I am also responsible for keeping our customers informed with status updates and maintaining customer service both over the phone and face-to-face. Connectivity Sales Manager Best Buy June 2010  –  January 2013  (2 years 8 months) 3140 S. Evans St. Greenville, NC Connectivity Sales Managers work with District Connect Sales Manager to support Best Buy's Connectivity specific goals and initiatives. The Store Manager oversees all operational aspects of running a store and gathers feedback to improve business performance. The manager supports goal achievement of the overall organization, district and store through modeling and coaching strong salesmanship and positive behaviors, driving customer satisfaction and retention goals, and coordinating relationships neighboring Best Buy Stores and the local Community at large. Store Managers are supported with an intensive orientation and ongoing training program to help achieve positive results in Best Buy's fast paced retail environment. 
 
During this time, I was largely responsible for leading a staff of 60+ employees and overseeing all operational aspects of running a Best Buy store to include P&L management, back office, cash handling, labor management and scheduling. I was responsible for overseeing company Shrink Programs and Merchandising Standards to include inventory control, merchandising/store appearance, promotions, displays, signage and pricing. As a people manager, I analyzed the store's performance indicators against team selling behaviors and goals, developed action plans to address objectives and achieve desired business results.  
 
During all parts of the fiscal year, I was responsible for on-boarding, hiring and training staff members. During the training process, I oversaw effective planning of team meetings and Training/Development Workshops, conducted weekly 1-on-1 consultations with employees, and provided coaching recognition and feedback in such a way that creates an open and approachable culture in the store. While I only sales floor, I was conducted sales and service role-plays to assist each location's staff in providing complete solutions to each customer. 
 
During this time, I was the Co-Chair and Chair of Best Buy's GLBT Employee Business Network. • Monitor the case-tracking tool for recreate requests. Locate and interconnect physical layer components. Establish layer 2 and layer 3 connectivity and load appropriate IOS images when required. Complete cases within specified time frame. 
• Update and maintain the Inventory Tracking Management and System for all equipment within CALO labs. 
• Maintain lab cleanliness. 
• Install and remove equipment within CALO labs. 
• Upgrade memory for routers, switches, and PCs. 
• Provide peer training and mentor newer coops. 
• Provide general lab infrastructure support. 
• Work towards Cisco certifications. Coops are expected to receive their CCNA before completing their first term. 
• Attend weekly team meetings.
